attributes.action: Review the Free Travel Policy for Senior Citizens both in the Greater London and Rural Areas of England
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As a Senior Citizen residing in the Greater London Area, their 'Freedom Pass' entitles the holder to travel Free across the rest of England with effect from 1st April 2008.
Why then, do you discriminate those Senior Citizens living outside the Greater London Area from travelling on the London Underground in 'off peak' periods?
Surely, all Senior Citizens should be treated alike, thus enabling them to enjoy their Free Travel inclusive of the London Underground wherever they reside!! Those residents within the Greater London Area will enjoy the facilities offered them in the Rural Areas of England, why then the discimination? One card for all.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
